intro: Senecio breweri, commonly known as the Brewer's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and medicinal properties. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid environments. It features narrow, gray-green leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. Senecio breweri is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats, where it plays a role in local ecosystems.
